intro: Lonicera zeravshanica, commonly known as the Zeravshan honeysuckle, is a shrub native to Central Asia, particularly found in the Zeravshan River valley in Uzbekistan. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to yellow, followed by red berries that are edible for birds and some mammals. Lonicera zeravshanica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its ornamental value and ecological significance make it an important species in local biodiversity.
